CAMBRIDGE CITY COUNCIL REGULAR MEETING
Monday, April 1, 2024

The Chair, Mayor Simmons asked the City Clerk to call the roll.
City Clerk LeBlanc called the roll.
Councillor Burhan Azeem – Present/In Person
Vice Mayor Marc C. McGovern – Present/In Person
Councillor Patricia Nolan – Present/In Person

Councillor Paul F. Toner – Present/In Person
Councillor Ayesha M. Wilson – Present/In Person
Mayor E. Denise Simmons – Present/In Person
Present-9. Quorum established.
PUBLIC COMMENT
The Chair, Mayor Simmons noted that public comment may be made in accordance with
Council Rules and MGL Chapter 30A, Section 20. Mayor Simmons also noted that the
meeting was being audio and video recorded by the City and could be being audio and
video recorded by members of the public. The Chair, Mayor Simmons noted that public
comment could be emailed to CityClerk@Cambridgema.gov. Mayor Simmons noted that
each person would get up to 3 minutes to speak.
The following individual was recognized for public comment.
James Williamson, Churchill Avenue, Cambridge, MA who spoke on CMA 2024 #66
(MBTA/83) and APP 2024 # 13 regarding a Ticket kiosk.
Public Comment remained open.

Minutes Acceptance: Minutes of Apr 1, 2024 5:30 PM (Submission of the Record)

A Regular Meeting of the Cambridge City Council was held on Monday, April 1, 2024. The
meeting was called to order at approximately 5:47 p.m. by the Honorable Mayor E. Denise
Simmons. Pursuant to Chapter 2 of the Acts of 2023, adopted by Massachusetts General
Assembly and approved by the Governor, this public meeting was hybrid, allowing participation
in person and via Zoom.

1

The Chair, Mayor Simmons made a motion to adopt the appropriation order in the
amount of $9,987.00 to support the work of the Center for Families and the Community
Learning Center in providing services to families at the State Overflow Shelter in
Cambridge and place CMA 2024 #65 on file.
City Clerk LeBlanc called the roll.
Councillor Burhan Azeem – Yes
Vice Mayor Marc C. McGovern – Yes
Councillor Patricia Nolan – Yes
Councillor Joan F. Pickett – Yes
Councillor Sumbul Siddiqui – Yes
Councillor Jivan G. Sobrinho-Wheeler – Yes
Councillor Paul F. Toner – Yes
Councillor Ayesha M. Wilson – Yes
Mayor E. Denise Simmons – Yes
Yes-9. Motion passed.
CITY MANAGER’S NON CONSENT AGENDA
The Chair, Mayor Simmons recognized Councillor Nolan on CMA 2024 #66 relative to the
MBTA Track Improvement work in February and July 2024 on the Red Line. Councillor
Nolan asked for more detail on the impact of free ridership and how we can use this opportunity
to gather useful data. The Chair, Mayor Simmons recognized Councillor Siddiqui who stressed
the importance of advocating for increased coverage. The Chair, Mayor Simmons recognized
Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler who offered comments on the report and asked for more details on
the dedicated bus lanes that were mentioned. The Chair, Mayor Simmons recognized Councillor
Pickett who commented on the congestion areas noted in the report and asked for additional
information on mitigation efforts including potential changes to traffic signals. The Chair,
Mayor Simmons recognized Councillor Wilson who asked if the City had a partnership with
Harvard that allowed residents to ride their shuttle for free. The Chair, Mayor Simmons asked
about the messaging and outreach strategies that will be implemented. Assistant City Manager
Farooq, Susanne Rasmussen, and Commissioner McKenna responded to comments and
questions.
The Chair, Mayor Simmons recognized Councillor Wilson who made a motion to place
CMA 2024 #66 on file.
The Chair, Mayor Simmons, called for a voice vote. The motion passed.
APPLICATIONS
The Chair, Mayor Simmons recognized Vice Mayor McGovern who made a motion to
adopt the order for APP 2024 #13, for a Tickets kiosk for Uptown Transport Inc.
The Chair, Mayor Simmons, called for a voice vote. The motion passed.

NON CONSENT POLICY ORDERS AND RESOLUTIONS
The Chair, Mayor Simmons recognized Councillor Azeem who spoke briefly on the
importance of POR 2024 #47 relative to City Council Support of H.3012/S.207, An Act
Authorizing Project Labor Agreements to strengthen and secure Massachusetts’ long term
economic development.
The Chair, Mayor Simmons recognized Councillor Toner who made a motion that all
members of the City Council be added as cosponsors.
The Chair, Mayor Simmons, called for a voice vote. The motion passed.
The Chair, Mayor Simmons made a motion to adopt POR 2024 #47 as amended.
